attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

effects.description:
Missile strength: +8% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

Barrier: +5% for Marauders of Tzeentch, Tzaangor, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +16% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Although it can be said that they have failed His tests, the broken minds and fluctuating, mutated bodies of Tzeeneth's lesser minions still have their uses.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch, Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe â€“ the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

skillTree.localised_description: The thundering of their Chaos Steeds and chariots announces the arrival of Kaldour's dread Knights, and death is never far behind them.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: For the Winged Watchers and Doomstriders of this world, their very lack of identifiable corporeal form shall be their armour against attack.

effects.description:
Armour: +6 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +9 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Lord of Change, Chaos Warshrine of Tzeentch, Soul Grinder (Tzeentch), Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Marauders, Tzaangors, Centigors of Tzeentch, Marauder Horsemen of Tzeentch, Chaos Chariots of Tzeentch, Chaos Warshrines, Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Of the many weapons available to Tchar, derangement must surely be the greatest and most satsifying to wield.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +12% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change, Soul Grinder units, Cockatrice and Mutalith Vortex Beast units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +12% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Changebringers, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Warriors of Tzeentch, Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Chosen of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
As they are a most adept and dedicated magic-user, where this one treads, the Winds always blow high and hard.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +5%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +5%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +10%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic changing in strength: +15%
	(local province)

Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +15%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption - as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeeneth are fed and nourished.
Tzeentch knows that at their cores all beings desire Change, and as such there are no shortage of recruits willing to march under his many-coloured banner.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Daemonic units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is low.
	
	Daemonic units also have:
	Physical Resistance
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
Blessed with the transformative boons of Tzeeneth, this one can travel further by his feathered wings, whether they be figurative or literal.
Beguilement and confusion are exuded wherever this servant of Change walks, foxing even the most adept combatants and magic-users.
This one has become the conduit through which the Great Conspirator weaves His sorcerous webs, affecting glorious Change through magical means.

effects.description:
Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
	(local province)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The unseen threads by which the world is connected can be re-woven at Tzeentch's will. This one sees the patterns and how they can be manipulated.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one seeks to sow the seeds of confusion, dissent and dishonesty, for such are the insidious ways of the Changer.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

target_if: Not on or below a platform
